snippet: Opponents of the prime minister are prodding foreign governments and agencies to look into allegations of graft and money laundering related to the his personal financial accounts.
abstract: Opponents of Malaysian Prime Min Najib Razak, some from within his own administration, have begun to assist international inquiries into financial impropriety as government cracks down on investigations at home; Khairuddin Abu Hassan, representing country's ruling party, is traveling to law enforcement agencies around world delivering information packets on 1Malaysia Development Berhad, sovereign wealth fund at heart of scandal.

byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: Opponents of the prime minister are prodding foreign governments and agencies to look into allegations of graft and money laundering related to the his personal financial accounts.

headline.main: Investigations Stymied in Malaysia, Critics of Najib Razak Take Their Case Global
headline.print_headline: ‘Road Show’ Seeks Inquiry of Malaysian Leader
